item.title: After the icy Brexit years, the UK's relationship with the EU might thaw following the election
item.description: The Labour Party says it wants to "reset" relations with the EU but doesn't want to scare swing voters away from the party.

item.title: The 'death knell' sounded for the Conservative Party long before the UK election, polling guru says
item.description: "This is not an election about the ideological position of the parties, this is an election about competence," said the U.K.'s polling expert, John Curtice.

item.title: Pics: Tear Gas, Rocks, And Looting As Kenya Police And Protesters Clash
item.description: Crowds in Kenya's capital Nairobi lobbed rocks and looted businesses as police officers fired tear gas in scattered violence during fresh anti-government protests on Tuesday following last month's deadly demonstrations.

item.title: "Genocide-Enabling": Another US Official Quits Over Biden's Gaza Policy
item.description: President Joe Biden's support for Israel during its nearly nine-month war in Gaza has spurred at least nine U.S. administration officials to quit.

item.title: Relief For Trump As Hush Money Case Sentencing Delayed Till September
item.description: By invoking the Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity, former US President Donald Trump has won a timely reprieve by getting the court to agree to delay his sentencing till after the Republican Party Convention.

item.title: Hundreds of candidates drop out of French election runoff in last gasp bid to keep far right from power - CNN
item.description:
1. Hundreds of candidates drop out of French election runoff in last gasp bid to keep far right from power  CNN
  2. Opinion | France, With Elections, Is Headed for Disaster  The New York Times
  3. The Making of the 28-Year-Old Star of France's Far Right  The Wall Street Journal
  4. Hundreds of candidates pull out of French run-off in bid to foil far right  Al Jazeera English
  5. Friends, foes of France's far-right National Rally scramble after first round of voting  The Associated Press

item.title: What is the new OSHA rule? Biden proposes heat protection regulations as US swelters
item.description: The proposed OSHA heat rules, supported by President Joe Biden, aim to safeguard workers from extreme temperatures. California faces wildfires and record heat, with health experts stressing the importance of heat stroke awareness. The proposal faces potential opposition from businesses and trade groups, highlighting the ongoing challenges posed by climate change.

item.title: Across the market towns of Britain the battle for the soul of the right is fierce
item.description:
The race in rural Louth and Horncastle, a previously unassailable Tory seat, encapsulates Reform’s real threat

As the traders pack up under the striped awnings of the market stalls in the centre of Alford, east Lincolnshire, Matthew Warner is loading balls of wool from his family shop into the back of his car.

Warner, a father of two, is feeling a serious strain on the family finances from fuel prices and childcare, and his wife cannot work full-time hours as a nurse because of the costs. A longtime Tory voter, the 33-year-old is still undecided on who he will vote for on Thursday, but he says he is now attracted by Nigel Farage’s Reform party, who are making significant inroads in seats like this.

Continue reading...

item.title: Governor Shapiro announces property tax distribution, rebates for 2023
